Detailed Description

These are classes to automate the filling of what would be the plugin_config and plugin_data structures if we were using C, making the following valid (or close to valid): struct mod_blank { mod_blank( ... ) : hostname( "some-config-tag" [, &validator [, &default_setter] ] ) { ... } std::string& default_setter( std::string& s ){ ... return std::string( "asdf" ); } config_option< std::string > hostname; };

So a config options type is specified at runtime, and we can add new types sit on top of the lighttpd ones. i.e. we could have a network mask type, getting options from T_CONFIG_STRING and that checks for the correct formatting. If incorrect we could throw an exception to be caught by the set_defaults handler, or we could set it to the value returned by default_setter.
